content: 1 The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.
content_old: 1 The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.

content: 2 Beloved, I pray that in all things thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
content_old: 2 Beloved, I pray that in all things thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

content: 3 For I rejoiced greatly, when brethren came and bare witness unto thy truth, even as thou walkest in truth.
content_old: 3 For I rejoiced greatly, when brethren came and bare witness unto thy truth, even as thou walkest in truth.

content: 4 Greater joy have I none than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.
content_old: 4 Greater joy have I none than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.

content: 5 Beloved, thou doest a faithful work in whatsoever thou doest toward them that are brethren and strangers withal;
content_old: 5 Beloved, thou doest a faithful work in whatsoever thou doest toward them that are brethren and strangers withal;

content: 6 who bare witness to thy love before the church: whom thou wilt do well to set forward on their journey worthily of God:
content_old: 6 who bare witness to thy love before the church: whom thou wilt do well to set forward on their journey worthily of God:

content: 7 because that for the sake of the Name they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
content_old: 7 because that for the sake of the Name they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

content: 8 We therefore ought to welcome such, that we may be fellow-workers for the truth.
content_old: 8 We therefore ought to welcome such, that we may be fellow-workers for the truth.

content: 9 I wrote somewhat unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
content_old: 9 I wrote somewhat unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

content: 10 Therefore, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he doeth, prating against us with wicked words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that would he forbiddeth and casteth them out of the church.
content_old: 10 Therefore, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he doeth, prating against us with wicked words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that would he forbiddeth and casteth them out of the church.

content: 11 Beloved, imitate not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
content_old: 11 Beloved, imitate not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

content: 12 Demetrius hath the witness of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, we also bear witness; and thou knowest that our witness is true.
content_old: 12 Demetrius hath the witness of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, we also bear witness; and thou knowest that our witness is true.

content: 13 I had many things to write unto thee, but I am unwilling to write them to thee with ink and pen:
content_old: 13 I had many things to write unto thee, but I am unwilling to write them to thee with ink and pen:
